description.narrative: Our vision for this programme is a rare combination of cutting-edge rigorous research and innovative policy engagement. This proposal sets out a powerful approach to addressing one of the fundamental challenges of economic development.

participating-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office

recipient-country.narrative: 1 organisation (Centre for Economic Research in Pakistan (CERP) ) is conducting RA3 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.

1 organisation (NestBuilders International (SL) Ltd) is conducting RA3 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.
1 organisation (PNDK Solutions Limited) is conducting RA4 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.
1 organisation (TNS RMS Nigeria Limited ) is conducting RA4 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.

1 university (Bocconi University) is conducting RA4 research. Some of this is desk-based research in the country of the research partner focused on low income countries. While some is happening on-the-ground in low income countries.

1 university (Instituto Tecnologico Autonomo de Mexico (ITAM) ) is conducting RA3 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.

1 university (New York University in Abu Dhabi Corporation) is conducting RA4 and RA3 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.
1 university (University of Cape Town) is conducting RA3 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.

1 university (University of Oslo) is conducting RA4 research. Some of this is desk-based research in the country of the research partner focused on low income countries. While some is happening on-the-ground in low income countries.

13 organisations (CEGA, Harvard University, University of Wisconsin System, University of Pennsylvania, Yale University, University of Chicago, Duke University, University of Wisconsin Madison, University of Michigan, Boston University, University of California, Berkeley , Georgetown and Innovations for Poverty Action (IPA)) are working across a range of workstreams (RA3, RA4). Some of this is desk-based research in the country of the research partner focused on low income countries. While some is happening on-the-ground in low income countries.

2 universities (Goethe-Universität Frankfurt and Universität Göttingen) are conducting RA4 research. Some of this is desk-based research in the country of the research partner focused on low income countries. While some is happening on-the-ground in low income countries.

3 organisations (Institute for Financial Management and Research, Indian School of Business and J-PAL SA at Institute for Financial Management) are conducting RA3 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.

3 organisations (University of Dodoma, REPOA and Law Associates Advocates) is conducting RA2 and RA3 research. Some of this research is desk-based in the country of the research partner, while some is happening on-the-ground in country.

8 organisations (University of Kent, London School of Economics, University of Oxford, Electric Studio, The University Court of the University of Edinburgh, Elliott Klooss Advisory Ltd, Econ Films and Raw Pictures) are working across a range of workstreams (RA2, RA3, RA4). Some of this is desk-based research in the country of the research partner focused on low income countries. While some is happening on-the-ground in low income countries. Some of these organisations are providing general support across the whole project.

Our implementing partner, Paris School of Economics, is implementing RA3 and RA4 research, carrying out RCTs and case studies that analyse interactions between formal and informal institutions in relation to growth and development.

Our implementing partner, University of Namur, is implementing RA4 research, carrying out case studies that analyse interactions between formal and informal institutions in relation to growth and development.

Our research partner, South Asian Network on Economics Modelling (SANEM), is implementing RA2 research, exploring the relationship between the characteristics and the functioning of a country’s institutions and its economic development performance and constraints.

Our research partner, University of Copenhagen, Department of Economics, is implementing RA2 research, exploring the relationship between the characteristics and the functioning of a country’s institutions and its economic development performance and constraints.
